projects.name: Fourier Series
projects.title: Another way to understand Fourier Series
projects.desc_1: Discover the world of Fourier series, a fascinating representation of cosine and sine functions with respect to time. But what if we looked at their complementary functions? A simple yet captivating interplay of cosines and sines forms stacks of circles!
projects.desc_2: In my pursuit to understand Fourier series better, I created an interactive tool. Inspired by Mr. Fermi's famous Fermi's Elephant, it offers a playful and modest way to visualize Fourier series with all functions you want.

projects.name: Monty Hall problem
projects.title: A viral probabilistic paradox that sparks debate
projects.desc_1: A statistical dilemma arose a few years ago, sparking numerous debates among individuals. A seemingly simple situation: three doors, one prize, and a choice. The game show host opens a losing door and asks if you'd change your mind about your initial choice. Would YOU switch doors?
projects.desc_2: Uncover the secrets of the Monty Hall problem with my simple program. Through real simulations, explore the outcomes of both the "switching" strategy and "sticking to initial choice" strategy. Delve deeper into the probabilities and discover which approach maximizes your chances of winning the hidden prize behind the doors.

projects.name: Reseeet
projects.title: Simple network simulation for my courses at the university
projects.desc_1: In our college courses, we embarked on an exciting journey into the world of Java programming with a focus on network simulations. Inspired by the "Packet Tracer" software, we have created a simplified version that aligns perfectly with our field of study.
projects.desc_2: Through this project, we dive into the intricacies of the Java language while perfecting our networking skills. Through hands-on experience, we have developed a fundamental understanding of network interactions, packet management and data flow, paving the way for our future endeavors in this fascinating area of computer science.
